4.8.1	
Diagnosis
Blood analysis requires measurement of creatinine, and urinalysis requires repeat urine pH measurements and 
urine culture. In cases of mixed struvite stones the search of metabolic abnormalities in 24 hour urine after 
stone removal and infection control is suggested.
Surgically remove the stone material as completely as possible.
Prescribe antibiotics in case of persistent bacteriuria.
Prescribe ammonium chloride, 1 g, two or three times daily to ensure urinary acidification.

Prescribe methionine, 200-500 mg, one to three times daily, as an alternative, to ensure 
urinary acidification.
